# PTD Today Forward Watchlist (Rest of Year — Headline Signals Last 30 Days)

---

## 1) Themes to Watch  
- Rising regulatory and political pressures impacting offshore wind projects (e.g., Orsted’s $5B US offshore wind project halted)  
- Growth and pricing dynamics in solar PV manufacturing, especially China’s wafer pricing and module costs approaching CNY 1/W  
- Expansion of solar capacity in key markets (US projected 737.8 GW by 2035; India’s growing PV manufacturing capacity and new battery storage domestic content rules)  
- Potential vulnerabilities in subsea data infrastructure indicated by Finnish police seizing a ship allegedly cutting subsea cables  
- Increasing adoption of AI and digital twins in renewable energy applications, including floating PV systems  
- Semiconductor industry uncertainty reflected in Intel’s Arizona fab and broader AI “inference economics” developments  

---

## 2) What to Monitor Next  

### Grid / Transmission  
- Flexible grid connections for community solar mandated by a US state utility order — may accelerate distributed solar integration  
- Risks to subsea cables from geopolitical/security issues as shown by Finnish police action against alleged sabotage  

### Renewables  
- Off-shore wind: US regulatory challenges for major projects (Orsted case) and continued capacity growth internationally  
- Solar: Module pricing trends in China, UK solar CfD deployment, and large-scale projects in Bangladesh and India’s battery storage policy  
- AI-enabled digital twins for floating PV follow operational optimization trends  

### Oil & Gas  
- Not enough information in the headlines regarding oil & gas developments  

### Data Centers & AI  
- AI adoption affecting economics and trade outlooks, notable discussions on AI "inference economics" and Deepwater’s views on AI investment horizon  
- Semiconductor fab developments (Intel in Arizona) critical for AI hardware supply chains  

### Rare Earth / Critical Minerals  
- India’s mandate of 20% domestic content in battery storage points to localization and supply chain shifts in critical minerals usage  
- Not enough explicit information on rare earth supply or mining activities beyond battery storage content rules  

---

## 3) Regions / Companies Appearing Repeatedly  
- China: Leading in offshore wind single-unit capacity, solar PV manufacturing, wafer price movements  
- US: Regulatory shifts in community solar, AI investment environment, Intel chip fab developments  
- India: Expanding PV manufacturing (Waaree Energies), battery storage content mandates  
- Denmark-based Orsted: Offshore wind project challenges in the US  
- Finland: Subsea cable security incident involving Russian crew  

---

## 4) Constraints / Risks Implied by Headlines  
- Project delays and regulatory uncertainty in offshore wind (US halt of Orsted’s project)  
- Supply chain and manufacturing risk in solar PV due to Chinese wafer price hikes and potential company exits (Eging)  
- Security vulnerabilities to critical telecom/data infrastructure (subsea cable incident)  
- Potential penalties on utility efficiency incentives due to shifts to fixed charges in grid pricing models  
- Semiconductor industry supply uncertainties as Intel’s new fab fate remains uncertain  

---

*End of Forward Watchlist*
